title: Your Brain on Facebook: Neuropsychological Associations with Social Versus other Media
segmentation: Alright, so this is a project I do with Christy Fisher who is a graduate student at the University of Washington where she studies cognitive neuroscience.
So we're all obsessively F5 ING Twitter and on Tweetdeck and slurping up our Facebook feeds and everything right?
But when we do this for the most part, we're not normally wear.
Buying one of these?
So here I am.
You can see looking kind of goofy there you can see at the best in the picture on the left wearing Ari EG cap.
And this is a 32 electrode cap that measures electrical activity in the brain at 32 places, roughly evenly distributed around around my scalp and you can see in the middle there and there.
I am sort of jacked into the matrix.
Or actually that's just the cable that comes out.
It goes into an HD box and then we process all the data in Matlab.
And then the picture on the right is just me looking sort of thoughtful there as one should when their brain activity is being measured.
OK, so why might we do this in the context of social media?

Well, in the long term, you can certainly imagine possible input or even feedback into social interaction systems, but in the short term, and this is what we did in this particular project, we thought there was an opportunity to inform the design of social media systems through better understanding of automatic information processing.
And by automatic what I mean is human information processing that's largely below the.
Threshold of conscious awareness and in particular with with e.g how to use EG to do that.

To what extent to people's brains thinking on TV, for example, is associated with being addictive with telling a story with being interested, frivolous, personal and useful, and the way you do this, or the way we did this within this e.g paradigm is very classic, you know, sort of psychology computer based experiment where you go through a number of trials.
So let me just show you an example.

I'm.

Here is your year in social media.
I think that might be kind of fun.

Objects.

Say something else, you know which ones sort of right?

All.
Of course, with every limitation, there's an opportunity.
